docs.title: Mistbot Documentation
docs.text:
Mistbot is the primary utility and networking hub for the Attack on Titan: Revolution (AOT:R) community. Designed to serve a high-activity player base, the bot bridges multiple servers to unify the trading economy and verify the reliability of high-tier service carriers.

As the AOT:R meta shifts with new updates and prestige levels, Mistbot ensures that players have a secure, centralized location to find essential items and trusted assistance for the game's most challenging content.

docs.title: The Unified AOT:R Marketplace
docs.text: Trading in AOT:R can be fragmented across dozens of Discord channels. Mistbot solves this by creating a Global Feed that synchronizes trade data from seven major community servers.

docs.title: Structured Global Search
docs.text: Instead of scrolling through thousands of messages to find a specific Artifact or Cosmetic, users can query our global database. The search engine categorizes "HAVE" and "WANT" requests, allowing you to instantly see every active seller and buyer for your specific item.

docs.title: Smart Detection (Ghost Scraper)
docs.text: To keep the marketplace fluid, Mistbot utilizes an automated detection system. When a player sends a trade message in a designated channel, the bot identifies the offer and prompts the user to list it globally. This ensures the market remains up-to-date with the latest prices and item availability without requiring users to leave their preferred server.

docs.title: Carrier Verification and Reputation
docs.text: For high-level AOT:R content, such as Aberrant Raids, Warbringer encounters, and Serum grinding, trust is the most valuable currency. Mistbot provides a verified track record for players offering these specialized services.

docs.title: Service-Specific Vouches
docs.text:
Our vouching system is not just a simple number. It breaks down a player's history by the specific service provided, including:

  • Raids and Missions: Confirmation of successful boss clears and speedruns.
  • Serum and Myth Carries: Verification for the game's rarest drop requirements.
  • Fee-Based Services: A logged history of successful transactions for hire-based gameplay.

docs.title: Anti-Fraud Protection
docs.text: The system is managed by a dedicated Values Team and Staff oversight to ensure that all vouches represent genuine completions. This protects the community from unreliable service providers and ensures that high-ranking carriers on the leaderboard have earned their status through consistent performance.

docs.title: Community Integration
docs.text:
Mistbot is built for the players, by the players. It integrates directly into the daily workflow of the AOT:R community:

  • Global Accessibility: Use a single command center to manage your trades across the entire network.
  • Real-Time Alerts: Set notifications for rare items like Helena or specific Artifacts so you are notified the moment they are listed.
  • Rankings and Leaderboards: View the top-tier carriers and servers in the community through real-time statistics.

Mistbot is an independent community project and is not officially affiliated with the developers of Attack on Titan: Revolution, though it has their approval.

docs.title: Terms of Service
docs.text: By using Mistbot, you agree to abide by the following terms. These rules are in place to ensure a safe, fair, and transparent environment for the entire Attack on Titan: Revolution community.

docs.title: 1. External Platform Compliance
docs.text:
Mistbot operates within the ecosystems of Discord and Roblox. As such, any community or individual using this bot must strictly adhere to the following:

  • Discord Terms of Service: Your server and its members must not violate any Discord community guidelines.
  • Roblox Terms of Service: Activities such as "Cross-Trading" (trading Roblox items for real money or items in other games) are strictly prohibited and will lead to a global ban from Mistbot.
  • AOT:R Game Rules: Any attempt to use Mistbot to facilitate exploits, glitches, or behaviors that violate the official Attack on Titan: Revolution game rules is forbidden.

docs.title: 2. Market Conduct
docs.text:
To maintain the integrity of the Global Marketplace, the following behaviors are prohibited:

  • Fraudulent Listings: Posting fake "HAVE" or "WANT" offers to manipulate item values (Price Manipulation).
  • Spamming: Rapidly posting or deleting/re-posting the same trade to flood the Global Feed.
  • Ghosting: Repeatedly failing to follow through on trades after being contacted via the bot’s search engine.

docs.title: 3. Enforcement and Blacklisting
docs.text:
The Mistbot Management and Values Team reserve the right to: * Issue a Global Blacklist to any user found violating these terms. * Remove any server from the sync network if the community is found to be breaking Discord, Roblox, or AOT:R rules. * Wipe any user's data (Vouches/Market history) if evidence of manipulation is found.

Failure to read these terms does not exempt you from them. Terms are subject to update as the AOT:R meta and platform rules evolve.

docs.title: 🤖 MistAI: Experimental Assistant Overview
docs.text: MistAI is an experimental integration within the MistBot ecosystem. It utilizes a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture to process AOT:R-specific documentation and provide automated responses based on official game data.

docs.title: 🔍 Current Scope of Knowledge
docs.text:
The system is currently indexed to provide information on the following pillars of AOT:R gameplay:

  • Mechanics Verification: Clarification on human and titan progression, including the Prestige loop (1–5), leveling requirements, and skill tree interactions.
  • Database Queries: Access to item-specific data, such as drop rates for Titan Serums and rarity tiers for artifacts.
  • Economic Data: Current market estimates for trading (e.g., Key/Gem values) and secondary requirements like the Prestige 3 trading tax.

docs.title: 🛡️ Beta Limitations & Disclaimer
docs.text:
MistAI is currently in a Testing Phase. Users should be aware of the following professional constraints:

  • Model Uncertainty: As a Large Language Model (LLM) in beta, MistAI may occasionally generate "hallucinations" or factually incorrect statements. It does not replace human verification from the staff or official Trello.
  • No Predictive Strategy: The system is designed to retrieve existing data, not to simulate or predict "best" builds. Any recommendations should be viewed as references to current community trends found in its data source, rather than definitive gameplay advice.
  • Constraint Protocol: If the system cannot locate a direct match within the indexed data, it is programmed to state its limitations rather than fabricate a response.

docs.title: 🧪 Development Roadmap
docs.text:
We are actively fine-tuning the retrieval accuracy. During this period: 1. Usage Logs: All queries are logged to identify "knowledge gaps" where the AI provides unsatisfactory answers. 2. Data Patching: The underlying index is updated following major game patches (e.g., Update 4 meta shifts) to prevent the dissemination of legacy information. 3. Feedback Loop: Users are encouraged to report systematic errors to the development team to assist in the training process.

!!! warning "Accuracy Notice" MistAI is provided "as-is" during the beta period. The MistBot team is not responsible for in-game losses or trading errors resulting from AI-generated information. Always cross-reference critical data in the #help or #trading channels.

docs.title: 🛠️ Usage & Limits
docs.text: Using MistAI is simple, but there are a few rules to ensure the system remains available for everyone.

docs.title: How to use
docs.text:
Type the following command in the designated AI channel: ,ask [your question]

Example Queries: * ,ask what is the best serum for guard missions? * ,ask how do I reach Prestige 3? * ,ask what is the trade tax for a serum?

docs.title: Fair Use Policy
docs.text:
To prevent system overload, the following limits are active: - Rate Limit: 3 questions every 10 minutes per user. - Context: The AI only knows about AOT:R. It will decline questions about other games or general topics. - Accuracy: While highly accurate, the AI can occasionally provide "hallucinated" info. Always cross-check critical trades with staff.

!!! info "Pro Tip" Keep your questions specific. Instead of asking "Is this good?", ask "Is the Attack Serum good for solo raids?" for much better results.

docs.title: Market Module
docs.text: The Mist-Market is a unified global trading hub that connects multiple servers into one searchable economy. It centralizes trade activity into a single command center, removing the need to manually monitor individual channels.

docs.title: Command Center Interaction
docs.text: The primary interface is triggered by the ,market command. This interactive embed serves as the main dashboard for all user activities.

docs.title: Core Features
docs.text:
• Post Trade: A manual entry system using Discord Modals to define "HAVE" and "WANT" items.
  • Search Marketplace: A global query engine that filters the database for active sellers and buyers of specific items.
  • My Listings: A personal management interface where users can bump active offers to the top of the feed or remove completed trades.
  • Notifications: A system for setting keyword-based alerts that ping the user when specific items are listed.

docs.title: Automated Ghost Scraper
docs.text:
The Ghost Scraper functions as an entry assistant by monitoring trade channels across all connected servers.

  1. Extraction: The bot identifies trade-related messages and parses item data using natural language processing.
  2. Verification: The bot replies to the original message with an opt-in prompt.
  3. Database Sync: Upon user confirmation, the data is automatically logged to the central database and mirrored to the global feed.

docs.title: Contact and Reputation
docs.text: When a user initiates contact via the Search interface: * The bot bridges the connection between the 2 traders. * The system logs the interaction under "Successful Contacts," which serves as the primary metric for trade-specific reputation.

docs.title: Vouching System
docs.text: The vouching system is a reputation engine specifically designed for service carriers (Raids, Missions, etc.). It provides a verified track record for users providing assistance within the community.

docs.title: How to Vouch
docs.text:
After a service is completed, the client initiates a vouch for the carrier.

  1. Initiation: Type ,vouch @carrier or use /vouch @user.
  2. Selection: The bot will respond with an interactive embed containing buttons for various service categories:
    • Fee Carry
    • Raids Carry
    • Warbringer Carry
    • Serum Carry
    • Myth Carry
  3. Confirmation: Once a service type is selected, the carrier receives +1 vouch to their profile for that specific category.

docs.title: User Commands
docs.text:
These commands allow any member to interact with the reputation data.

Command Description ,profile @user Displays the full breakdown of a carrier's vouches by category. ,leaderboard Shows the top 10 all-time carriers within the current server. ,monthlylb Displays the top carriers based on activity within the current month. /lbservers A global metric showing top servers ranked by vouch-to-member ratio. /serverstats Displays the total cumulative vouches across the entire server.

docs.title: Administrative Commands
docs.text: Restricted to staff members for maintaining database integrity.

docs.title: Modification
docs.text:
• /addvouch @user: Manually adds a single vouch.
  • /remvouch @user: Removes a single vouch.
  • /massadd @user [count]: Adds a specific number of vouches to a profile.

docs.title: Reset Functions
docs.text:
• /resettype @user [type]: Clears all vouches from a specific category (e.g., Missions) for a user.
  • /resetuser @user: Permanently wipes all vouch data for the specified user.
